intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum subsp. cuneifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed oxeye daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with white petals surrounding a yellow center, blooming from late summer to early autumn. It prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it adaptable to a variety of garden conditions. This species is often used in ornamental gardening for its aesthetic appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
